Literature Review: Climate change is one of the most pressing issues of our time, with far-reaching consequences for the environment, human health, and the economy. The scientific consensus is clear: human activities, particularly the emission of greenhouse gases, are causing the Earth's temperature to rise at an unprecedented rate. The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has warned that if left unchecked, climate change could lead to catastrophic consequences, including sea-level rise, more frequent natural disasters, and devastating impacts on biodiversity (IPCC, 2018).
